column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#Text=[0073]Another example of incorporating additional components to the carpet tile can be in the woven or non-woven secondary backing layers.

#Text=For instance, if a different backing appearance or texture is desired, a high melt woven or non-woven scrim can be applied directly to the hardback layer while the hardback layer is still at an elevated temperature.

#Text=Optionally, compatibilizers or coupling agents can be incorporated into the any of the layers, such as the primary or the secondary backing layers, and can improve the bonding to the two materials.
#Text=[0074]Any of the materials for the layers of the carpet tile can be obtained from recycled materials or carpets.

#Text=For instance, fillers that incorporate post-industrial or post-consumer recycled content, such as fillers recovered from carpet recycling processes and/or ground glass from other recycling operations, can be substituted in part or in whole for the previously described fillers.
#Text=Optionally, recycled polymers can also be used.
#Text=Polymers recovered from industrial or post-consumer waste streams can be used to replace all or a portion of the previously described polymers.
#Text=Examples of recycled polymers, include, but are not limited to, recycled or reclaimed polyolefin, polyethylene and related polymers.
#Text=Alternatively, recycled or reclaimed carpet as can be used as feedstock.
#Text=Carpets manufactured in part with olefin polymers recovered from industrial or post-consumer carpet waste streams can be used to replace all or a portion of the previously described polymers.
#Text=The carpets would have to be reprocessed through grinding and re-melting processes prior to application in the process.
#Text=Recycled materials and techniques of using them can be accomplished using the techniques and materials described in, for example, U.S.
#Text=Pat.
#Text=Nos. 6,936,201 and 6,316,075, which are incorporated by reference herein in their entireties.
#Text=Preferably, the entire carpet tile or nearly the entire carpet tile is made from recycled materials.

#Text=[0075]Various coatings or layers are discussed previously and below, and unless stated otherwise, are preferably of a substantially uniform thickness and can be applied using techniques known to those skilled in the art.
#Text=The preparation of the composition for each layer can be by any technique known in the art.
#Text=For example, the preparation of the composition for the hot melt laminate layer can be accomplished with a variety of mixing techniques.
#Text=Preferably, the compositions of the laminate layer, or any layer, are produced by compounding in a hot-melt mixer, using a batch process.
#Text=The compositions can then be stored at an elevated temperature until needed.
#Text=The compound can also be cooled and pelletized until needed.
#Text=The pellets can be reheated prior to application or stored in a molten state until needed.
#Text=Alternatively, the compositions can be produced in a continuous mixing process and/or using a compounding extruder.
#Text=The compositions produced by this process can be applied directly to the coating line.
#Text=They can also be cooled and pelletized until needed.
#Text=The pellets can be reheated prior to application or stored in a molten state until needed.
#Text=[0076]The sequence of forming any of the various layers is not critical to the present invention.
#Text=Production of the carpet tiles may include intermediate steps of forming one or more carpet strata by joining two or more constituent layers together.
#Text=Furthermore, one or more of the layers may be formed "upside down" relative to the orientation of the finished product as a floor covering.
#Text=Thus, directional references are merely given for the purpose of aiding the reader and are not intended in any way to limit the scope of the present invention.

#Text=[0077]In each case, the individual layers described above, are affixed in some manner such as by casting, extruding, and/or laminating the various layers on a previously formed layer, or by other means conventional in the art.

#Text=As an alternative to using the primary backing as the substrate on which all other layers are applied, it is certainly within the bounds of the present invention to form any layer of the surface covering first and then add other desirable layers to the top and/or bottom surface of the first layer formed.
#Text=For example, the hardback layer can be formed first and all of the other layers applied thereon or alternately all layers could be applied on the secondary backing.
